result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentencing hearing on November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:29 PM cases 21CT320, 21CT363, 22CF144, 21TR9073, 21TR9074 called. Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Alexander J. Solie in court with Attorney Brian A Braziel. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Victim K.L. is present in courtroom with Attorney Lee. Defense recites joint sentencing recommendation. Victim is requesting that a PSI be ordered. 

22CF144: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Strangulation and Suffocation Domestic Abuse Repeater and Count 5: Battery Domestic Abuse Repeater

Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 

Court accepts the pleas and finds the defendant guilty.

Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 

Court orders Pre-Sentence Investigation due by 10/28/2022.

Sentencing Hearing set for 11/17/2022 at 9:00 AM (1 hours in person)

Court orders any alternate PSI by 11/11/2022

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:05 PM.
Defendant Alexander J. Solie appeared in court, Attorney Erika Amundson appeared in court for Alexander J. Solie, Attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Amundson was just appointed today and the parties jointly request an adjournment to 3/8/22.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Erika Amundson at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100 beginning 03/11/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance, 02/03/2022

Conditions:
No contact with K.L. or K.L.'s family.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
Not to access any social media accounts, emails, photos of K.L.
Not to access any phones or internet for 5 days.
Preliminary hearing on February 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

(Case called at 11:09 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Alexander Solie appears by video from the Eau Claire County Jail with Attorney Karl Schmidt. Attorney Trenton Piltz appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the Complaint. State requests $10,000 cash bond reciting the criminal history of the Defendant. Victim K.L. appears in person and makes a statement. Defense objects and requests a lower cash bond. Court orders $10,000 cash bond with various conditions. Defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived. 
Preliminary Hearing: 2/15/2022 at 2:30 PM.

Conditions:
No contact with K.L. or K.L.'s family.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
Not to access any social media accounts, emails, photos of K.L.
Not to access any phones or internet for 5 days.
